tit.e: "Honmatsu Seido" (The Hierarchical System To Control All Temples In The Edo Period)
"Honmatsu Seido" (The hierarchical system of the Edo period by which to control all temples)

sen.j: 本末制度（ほんまつせいど）は、江戸時代、徳川幕府が仏教教団を統制するために設けた制度である。
sen.e: "Honmatsu seido" was a system to control the Buddhist organizations, which was established in the Edo period by the Tokugawa shogunate.
"Honmatsu seido," a system intended to control the Buddhist organizations, was established by the Tokugawa shogunate during the Edo period.

sen.j: 各宗派の寺院を重層的な本山・末寺の関係に置くことで、その宗派に対する統制をはかった制度である。
sen.e: It aimed to control Buddhist sects by placing each of their temples in the hierarchy from main temple to branch one.

sen.j: そのため、無本寺寺院をゼロにして、寺院相互の本末関係を固定化してしまう必要があった。
sen.e: Therefore, the shogunate needed to eliminate the temple that belonged to no main temple, and fix the hierarchy of all temples.

sen.j: 1631年、新寺の創建を禁止し、翌年以降、各本山に対して「末寺帳」の提出を義務づけた。
sen.e: In 1631, the shogunate banned the construction of a new temple, and from the next year, it forced every main temple to submit "matsuji cho" (list of the sub-temples).

sen.j: 本末制度は寺請制度や寺院諸法度の創設と連動していた。
sen.e: Honmatsu seido was linked with other shogunate policies, such as the establishment of "terauke seido" (the system to force the public to become a Buddhist) and "jiin shohatto" (the regulations for Buddhist temples).

sen.j: これらの幕府の政策は、各宗派の活動の中心にあった門派や塔頭の教団機能を低下させ、各本山への権限の集中を招いた。
sen.e: These shogunate policies reduced the organizational function of "monpa" (a division of a Buddhist sect) and of "tacchu" (a minor temple), both of which played the central role in Buddhist activities in each sect in those days, while the policies caused the concentration of religious power on each main temple.
